comments:
RC2

- Project "P"
- create a file P/folderfile
- create a file P/file
- open file
- choose file->save as...
- as folder location to save at, choose P/filefolder
- press ok

-> Exception below.

This can only be seen once bug 60795 has been fixed.

The test case is wrong. Correct is:
- create project "P"
- in P create file "file1"
- in P create file "file2"
- open file2
- File > Save As...
- type "P/file2" into parent folder entry field
- click OK

Actually, this is always reproducible if you don't choose to save under its own,
but a different name:

- create project "P"
- in P create file "file1"
- in P create file "file2"
- open file2
- File > Save As...
*- type "P/file1" into parent folder entry field
- click OK

The effect is that the CCE is printed on stdout (if -consolelog specified).
There is not dialog, the file is not saved.

Really, the save dialog should not allow saving to a bogus destination, such as
a directory name that is really a file.

However, we must protect ourselves from such a case in filebuffers land and have
to throw an exception.

Created an attachment (id=12460)
o.e.core.filebuffers.diff

when checking an existing resource, we throw a CoreException if any specified
path segment exists but is not a folder.
